szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors

Class AbstractActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.actors.AbstractActor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActorBasic, ActorPrivileged, ActorUpdatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractMoveableActor, PipeSegment, Wall

    public abstract class AbstractActor
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActorPrivileged
    Partial implementation of the ActorPrivileged interface containing common code for all actors.

      • getType

        public ActorType getType()
        Description copied from interface: ActorBasic
        Gets the general category of the actor. Note: this is not the actual class of an actor, just an enum constant grouping possibly multiple actor classes according to their role within the game (different Enemies, different calibers of Bullets etc.).
        Specified by:
        getType in interface ActorBasic
        Returns:
        The ActorType of the actor.

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()
        Description copied from interface: ActorBasic
        Gets the current orientation of the actor relative to the screen (facing left, right, up, down). Possibly could be better named getOrientation().
        Specified by:
        getDirection in interface ActorBasic
        Returns:
        the Direction that the actor is facing in.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(ActorBasic other)
        Description copied from interface: ActorBasic
        Returns true if this actor intersects the actor passed as parameter to this method. Most commonly this means whether their current position, or TunnelCell objects are equal, though if not, it checks if their rectangles touch or overlap at any point).
        Specified by:
        intersects in interface ActorBasic
        Parameters:
        other - The actor to check if it intersects this actor.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the given actor is not null and intersects this actor | false otherwise.

      • setCurrentPosition

        protected void setCurrentPosition(TunnelCellUpdatable currentPosition,
                                  int x,
                                  int y)
        Sets the actor's x, y coordinates. Must be within some existing tunnel cell.
        Parameters:
        currentPosition - the tunnel cell in which the new (x, y) coordinates are located in.
        x - the new horizontal coordinate.
        y - the new vertical coordinate.
